Content.Text:
<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congrats on the win, <MYNAME>! Where'd you
go to catch all those fish?
<PAGE>
You've gotta tell me where the good spots are
sometime.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Hey, <MYNAME>, congrats on the win! Y'know,
you're pretty good at a whole lot of different
things.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Man, I'm gonna have to work harder so I can
stay worthy of you. That way you won't be
tempted to go fishing...for a different guy!
<PAGE>
Huh? What am I talking about? Uh, that was a
joke. You know...this is a "fishing" contest?
Going "fishing" for a new man...
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>Hey, what's with that look? Okay! Okay! I
shouldn't have said that! I'm sorry, honest!
Please come back!

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Great job, <MYNAME>. Congrats on the win!
<PAGE>
With as good at fishing as you are, we won't
ever have to worry about putting food on the
table. ♪

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Great job, <MYNAME>. Man, this year's Fishing
Tournament sure was lots of fun, wasn't it?
<PAGE>
Results are important, yeah, but you've gotta
remember to enjoy the chance to go fish! I can't
wait for the next year's contest! ♪

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Great job, <MYNAME>. Hn? You look kinda
down. Depressed because you didn't win?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>This ain't the last contest ever, y'know. No
matter how things turn out, you gotta remember
to have fun.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>But if you're really, really sad, I'll fling my arms
wide open so you can jump into 'em for a big
consolation hug!
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>W-wait, why are you laughing? I really meant it!
Oh well...looks like you've cheered up, and that's
what's important.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Man, it stinks you didn't win. Still, there's a lot
of luck to fishing. I guess your luck wasn't quite
enough this time.
<PAGE>
Ah, I know! I'll make a deeee-licious dinner for
you tonight, to help cheer you up.
<PAGE>
So let's go home, eat some yummy food, laugh
a lot and get a good night's sleep. By tomorrow,
I'll bet you'll feel a whole lot better. ♪

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Woohoo! I did it! I won! Now I'm one step -- no,
a hundred steps! -- closer to my goal of being
the world's greatest fisherman! ♪
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Wait, hold on a second. My goal is to be the
world's greatest FARMER, not FISHERMAN.
Whew. Almost lost sight of my goal, there.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOVE>
<MYNAME>, I did it! I won! So yeah, remember
how I told you that, if I won, there was
something important I was gonna tell you?
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>What? You don't remember? Didn't I mention it
to you when I was over at your place last night?
<PAGE>
You never saw me last night? Wait, was that all
just a dream?! Arrrrgh! My plans! All my plans!
N-no...it's nothing at all... Dang it.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Woohoo! I won! Heh heh heh! It's only right that
I get to show off how awesome a husband I am
every now and then. ♪
<PAGE>
Okay, now to fry up those fish I caught into the
best dinner you ever had--
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>Oh wait, that's right...I let all the fish I caught
go! Dang it. I kinda wish I'd kept one as a
trophy, but rules are rules.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
Man, I didn't catch nearly as many fish as I
thought I would. I guess I just wasn't quite lucky
enough this time.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Well, I'm gonna win next time. I can just feel it
in my bones!

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Dang it! My plan to show off how awesome I
can be by winning today and then making you
fall for me even more is ruined!
<PAGE>
Everything played out perfectly in my head, too,
but none of it works if I don't actually win!
Arrrrrgh.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
Man, and I'm pretty good at fishing, too. Oh
well. I guess luck just wasn't on my side this
time.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>And this was a great chance to show off for
you, too. I'll do it next year, though. Just you
watch!

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This year's Fishing Tournament sure was fun!
Still, I kinda wish we could've kept at least one
or two of the fish we caught. They looked tasty.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
Man, I sure caught a whole bunch of old boots
and cans this year.
<PAGE>
Folks have gotta take better care of their stuff,
y'know? And besides, it's totally uncool to throw
trash in the river.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Congratulations. It seems you are quite the
skilled angler.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>We should go fishing together sometime. Then
you can show me the tricks of the trade that
earned you that blue ribbon.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Congratulations, <MYNAME>. Since you're such
an accomplished angler, perhaps we should go
on a fishing-date sometime.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>Er...though thinking about it a "fishing-date"
sounds like something only an old man would
come up with, doesn't it?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Ah well. If you'd rather not fish, we can do
something else. I don't mind what kind of a date
it is, as long as I'm with you.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I had a feeling you might win, <MYNAME>. But I
was still shocked to see it actually happen.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>This calls for a celebration. I'll make whatever
you'd like for dinner, so start thinking about
what you'd like to have.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well done, <MYNAME>. You may not have won,
but do not let it get to you too much.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Effort always pays off - if not now, then in the
future. Just think of this as preparation for next
time's victory.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well done, <MYNAME>. You gave it your best. If
you want to take your mind off things, perhaps
we can stop by somewhere on the way home.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well done, <MYNAME>. It's unfortunate you
didn't win, but you gave a rousing effort.
<PAGE>
Is there anything you'd like for dinner tonight? I'll
make whatever you're in the mood for.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>On days like today, there's nothing wrong with
asking for a little pampering. There isn't much
else I could do for you, anyway.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
If I were a few years younger, I might've
participated myself.
<PAGE>
But I'm too old to go running from fishing hole
to fishing hole, trying to reel in a massive catch
in so short a time.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
While you and the other contestants were
fishing, the rest of us stayed here and chatted so
that we didn't disturb you.
<PAGE>
Fishing and chatting...two time-honored ways of
whiling away a few hours, wouldn't you say?

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congrats, <MYNAME>. I'm impressed. Where do
you hide the strength to reel in all those fish in
those skinny arms of yours?

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Congrats, <MYNAME>. Hm? Uh-oh. You cut
your finger. There, see?
<PAGE>
There's nothing wrong with giving something
your all, but you should still be careful not to get
yourself hurt.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>There, that should do it. Be a little more careful
next time, okay?

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congrats. When did you get that good at
fishing? I'm kinda surprised.
<PAGE>
Anyway, this calls for a celebration. Let me
know if you have any special requests for dinner
tonight!

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
It's too bad you didn't win today. But don't let it
get'cha down. Remember, there'll always be a
next time.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Here, <MYNAME>, say "aaaaah." Tastes pretty
good, huh?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>That's one of my special, home-made Pick-Me-
Up Sweets. Things didn't turn out how we'd
hoped, but I hope you feel a little better now.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good job today, <MYNAME>. When we get
home, I'm going to pamper you silly, so get
ready.
<PAGE>
Hm? You're afraid if I pamper you too much,
you'll get soft and won't have that hard edge you
need for competition?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Haha, c'mon! I've always taken every chance I
get to pamper you. What guy DOESN'T want
lavish love on his lady?

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'd figure that whether or not you fish regularly is
a pretty big factor in contests like these.
<PAGE>
After all, a beginner wouldn't know where all the
best fishing spots are.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Still, we've got the phrase "beginner's luck" for a
reason, and there's no accounting for luck.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I used to go fishing a lot when I was a kid, but
I'm so busy now I don't have the time.
<PAGE>
At this point, I've gotten completely rusty. I can't
catch nearly as many fish as I used to.
<PAGE>
Fishing is considered a sport, though, so I guess
like any sport, you have to keep practicing to
stay good at it.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I've heard that fishing requires a considerable
amount of upper-body strength.
<PAGE>
You won the Fishing Tournament, so now I'm
thinking you must be stronger than you look.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Which makes sense, given the workout you get
every day as a farmer.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congratulations on your victory. Hm? You want
to go on a "fishing-date" with me some time?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>Er...I see. While I would love to see the skills
that earned you the blue ribbon today, I
ah...think I'll have to pass.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Though if you'd like to go on a regular date, you
have but to name the place. It's guaranteed to be
more interesting than fishing.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congratulations on your victory. We will have to
celebrate tonight.
<PAGE>
Is there a particular dish you would like to have
for dinner tonight? Let me know if you have any
requests.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well done, today. It is unfortunate that you didn't
win.
<PAGE>
However, catching fewer fish than you expected
is hardly something to get depressed over. Do
not let it bother you so much.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Results are important, but they don't tell the full
story. It is unfortunate that you did not win this
time...
<PAGE>
...But I am sure you have learned some valuable
lessons from the experience. Do not feel too
disheartened.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Someday, you will benefit from what you
learned today. When that time comes, you will
stand triumphant. Of that I am certain.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well done, <MYNAME>. It is unfortunate you
didn't win today.
<PAGE>
As a consolation prize, I will make my special
iced tea for you when we get home.
<PAGE>
I hope you realize how much of a privilege
having my iced tea is. Only you and my sister
have earned the honor of drinking it.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Well? Doesn't that sound like a far rarer and
more enticing prize than a simple blue ribbon?

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I think the decision to release all the caught fish
back into the river was the correct one.
<PAGE>
Having so many fish removed from the river in
such a short period of time could negatively
affect the river's ecosystem.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I am very glad that participation in the Fishing
Tournament is on a purely voluntary basis.
<PAGE>
If it was mandatory for all residents, I think I
might suddenly come down with a terrible
migraine on this day of the year.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
So you won, eh? Not bad. Where'd you go to
catch 'em all?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>N-not that I care about what you think are good
fishing spots. I was just, y'know...curious.
That's all.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congrats. Y'know, you really do give just about
everything.
<PAGE>
I like that about you.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>AH! N-not in THAT way, though! Just in the
normal, I-respect-that-as-a-person kind of way!

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congrats. We should celebrate tonight. I'll make
whatever you want for dinner.
<PAGE>
Let me know what sounds good, 'kay?

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You lost? Yeah, I've got eyes. You didn't have to
come tell me that.
<PAGE>
Or were you expecting me to say something
tender and comforting to make you feel better?
<PAGE>
You'll be waitin' a long time, then. I don't really
do the whole "consoling" thing.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You okay, <MYNAME>?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>Er, it's nothing. I was just, uh, wondering if you
were feeling down about losing.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>N-not like I was gonna try to cheer you up or
anything! That ain't my kind of thing. A-
anyways, I'm just glad you're okay.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Everything's done, right? C'mon, let's get ready
to go.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Is there anything you wanna have for dinner
tonight? I'll take requests.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>So uh...ahem...can you, um...cheer up? Please?
It doesn't feel right to see you not smiling.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I never liked being the center of attention, but it
does feel kinda nice to win.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
What, did you come over to congratulate me?
What'd you do something like that for?
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>Gah! W-wait, no! It's not that you're bugging me
or anything, it's just...uh...
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>Doesn't the fact that people could be watching
us bother you?
<PAGE>
They do, too. There's always someone lookin' at
us, and...and giving us that annoying, knowing
smile. I hate that!
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>But yeah, I should've worded that better at the
beginning. Sorry.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Heh. When I decide I wanna do something, I
don't pussyfoot, I go and do it.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>Bwuh? Y-you love me even more now? GAH! T-
there's no need to say stuff like that out loud!

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
Not that I went into this dead-set on winning,
but having lost still kinda sucks.
<PAGE>
I'm surprised how serious I ended up getting
about this...at least, enough to be disappointed
at losing.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Huh? You're here to console me?
<PAGE>
What for? Besides, you're the one with the
dopey sad-face. I'm surprised you'd feel that way
over what happened to someone else.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Still, that sad-dog look on you is pretty funny.
I'm actually starting to feel a little better now.
<PAGE>
Don't get so mad. I meant it as a compliment.
Thanks, <MYNAME>.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
Ugh. I'm kinda ticked off that I didn't catch as
many as I thought I would today.
<PAGE>
<FACE_ANGRY><MYNAME>, c'mere a sec and put your head
where I can reach it. People say petting small
animals helps you de-stress.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>H-hey, what're you so mad about? I don't think
you're some kinda animal, y'know.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>The point is, bein' close to something cute that
you love helps, right? So hold still a sec. I
wanna run my hand through your hair.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Sometimes you reel in the craziest junk when
you fish.
<PAGE>
Catching something like that in the middle of the
Fishing Tournament would drive me nuts, so I
pray the whole time I don't hook one.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I like fishing. You can start and stop whenever
you want, so it's the perfect time-killer.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congrats! I heard from some of the other
contestants that you've got really good form
when you reel in a catch.
<PAGE>
No wonder you landed this win so nicely. Do
you fish often?
<PAGE>
Cool. I'd love it if you could show me a few
tricks sometime.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Congrats, <MYNAME>. I'd better step up my
game so I can keep up with you.
<PAGE>
There's supposed to be a flower arranging
contest going on in the city soon, and I was
waffling over whether I'd enter it...
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>But seeing how you steamrolled the competition
today helped me make my decision. I'm gonna
sign up!
<PAGE>
These contests don't come around that often, so
I hope I can follow up your performance with a
win of my own.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congrats, <MYNAME>. You have to be
exhausted after all that.
<PAGE>
Let me handle all the house chores tonight,
then. You just sit back and relax, okay?

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good job today, <MYNAME>. Are you feeling
okay? Today was a really hot day to be out in
the sun for so long.
<PAGE>
You've gotta take care not to get a sunburn, or
even heat stroke. Winners and losers don't
matter much if you collapse, y'know.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, hey <MYNAME>. Good job today. It's too
bad about you not winning and all, but don't let
it get to you.
<PAGE>
Sure, it'd be nice to come home with that blue
ribbon, but at the end of the day...
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>...I think the most important thing is that you
enjoyed yourself.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Good job today, <MYNAME>. It's too bad you
didn't win, but there's always next time.
<PAGE>
If there's anything I can do to help you prep for
the next contest, just let me know. 
<PAGE>
I love helping you out, no matter what it is. I feel
like I'm always learning something new.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I heard that earlier, someone caught a fish so big
they couldn't reel it in.
<PAGE>
If they could've managed it, they probably
would've locked in a trophy right there.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
A fishing contest, eh? The town I used to live in
had something like that.
<PAGE>
You didn't fish with a rod, though. You'd try
catching fish by hand in knee-deep water. I
wasn't too hot at it, myself.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Congratulations on a nice performance today.
Hm? You think it feels strange to hear an honest
congratulations from me?
<PAGE>
<FACE_ANGRY>Well pardon me! I DO congratulate people
properly, like anyone else would! ...When they
deserve it.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>I haven't the slightest interest in winning this
contest for myself, of course. That makes it
easier to congratulate you.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Congratulations, <MYNAME>. I'm surprised you
won. I never realized you were so skilled at
fishing.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congratulations, <MYNAME>. I'm surprised you
could do so well in this oppressive heat.
<PAGE>
Come, then. Let us hurry home for afternoon
tea. I can hardly stand around out here all day --
this heat is making me feel faint.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
Simply watching the Fishing Contest is enough
to exhaust me. I can hardly understand why
people would want to enter it.
<PAGE>
I would never do it myself. All of you can enjoy
your fish-wrangling yourselves. I will be going
home.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>, would you care to visit my
mansion later this afternoon? A delivery of
sweets I ordered will be arriving today.
<PAGE>
The wait-list for these luxury candies is a year
long, you know. If you don't stop by today, a
commoner like you might never see them again.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>But for you, <MYNAME>, I might be willing to
make a special exception and share them with
you. So please cheer up, all right?

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well done, <MYNAME>. Hm? Are you feeling
down?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>It hardly feels right, to see you like that.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Well, I guess I shall have to do something about
that! Tonight, I'll make your favorite, so cheer
up, okay?

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Fish disgust me. They're slimy, they gleam in a
disgustingly oily fashion, and worst of all, they
smell.
<PAGE>
I detest whoever invented fishing rods. If they
hadn't, then fish could have stayed in the water,
and we wouldn't ever need to see them.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Don't you think fishing a waste of time?
<PAGE>
If you are simply going to stand there and wait
for a fish to arrive, why not spend the time
elegantly enjoying a cup of tea instead?

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, hello <MYNAME>. Congratulations on the
big catch. Do you go fishing regularly?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Then I guess today's your well-deserved reward
for all that practice.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congratulations, <MYNAME>. Most of us just
sat here, chatting quietly, so that we wouldn't
get in the way and disturb the fish.
<PAGE>
But now I find myself wishing I had sneaked
away to witness the epic struggle between man
and fish.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congratulations, <MYNAME>. I'm so glad to see
you take the prize!
<PAGE>
We'll have to celebrate tonight. Is there anything
in particular you'd like for dinner? I'll fish around
and see what I can make.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
It's unfortunate you didn't win today,
<MYNAME>. But take heart, you'll get another
chance soon enough.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Is it all right for you to head home now,
<MYNAME>? Then let's go together.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Oh dear...do you think I'm just being considerate
because you lost?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Ohoho! Winning and losing have nothing to do
with it. I just want to spend as much time with
you as I can.
<PAGE>
If it means we can be together, I can fabricate as
many excuses as you'd like.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well done, <MYNAME>. It's unfortunate that you
didn't win, but everyone has days like these, you
know.
<PAGE>
The most important thing is to learn from what
happened today and put that toward improving
yourself for next time.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>I'll help you however I can. Let's both think of
what we can do to snatch that blue ribbon next
time.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I often hear people say that fishing is a good
way to pass the time, but I prefer a good book,
myself.
<PAGE>
There are hundreds of books published every
day. No matter how many I read, there will
always be new adventures waiting for me.
<PAGE>
And not only am I enjoying myself, I'm also
learning new things. What better way could
there be to pass the time?

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
A gentleman I dated some time ago often said
nothing was more manly or exciting than
fishing. He often skipped our dates to go fish.
<PAGE>
Now, I won't say getting lost in your hobbies is
bad, and I understand being passionate about
them, but there's such a thing as moderation.
<PAGE>
I don't consider a gentleman who values a
woman's attention less than a fish's to be a real
catch. That relationship didn't last long.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Oh, hey <MYNAME>!
<PAGE>
I think it's cool that you have a skill you're good
enough at that you can show it off to people. I
need to find something like that.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOVE>
Oh...hi, <MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
Hm? My face is red? W-well, yeah. Everybody
was teasing me.
<PAGE>
They'd say stuff like how lucky I am to have
such a stud for a boyfriend, and that you
must've used your fishing skills to reel me in.
<PAGE>
Um, a-and other stuff like that. I-I'm sorry if I'm
bad at this. I've never dated anyone before, and it
looks like people love teasing me about it.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congrats, <MYNAME>!
<PAGE>
I didn't get to watch you while you fished, but I
heard from the other contestants that you were
doing great.
<PAGE>
That kinda makes me wish I could've seen you in
all your fishing glory.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You might not have won, but I think you did a-
okay, <MYNAME>. Fishing looks like it's really
hard. Maybe there's some kind of trick to it?

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Um, <MYNAME>...? Cheer up, okay? It's not
that bad. Let me know if there's anything I can
do to put your mind at ease.
<PAGE>
I wanna do whatever I can to make you feel
better.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good job today, <MYNAME>. Angela just taught
